title: The Lighthouse: Robert Pattinson would 'beat himself up' to get into character
text:
Robert is going full method for his latest role (Picture: Rex Features)

Willem Dafoe has doubled down on Robert Pattinson’s claims of ‘wetting himself’ on The Lighthouse set, as he revealed how his co-star got into character for the drama horror.

The pair’s latest film is set in 1890, with Robert playing lighthouse apprentice Ephraim Winslow to Willem’s character, Thomas Wake.

Speaking about the 33-year-old Twilight star, 64-year-old Willem has revealed just how method things got.

Much to Willem’s bewilderment.

Speaking of Robert’s expertise, Willem stated to Mr Porter: ‘He’s not interested in craft, I think. He wants to throw himself into deep water and he feels like it will only be true if he’s drowning.

The pair star in The Lighthouse

‘For me that seemed wacky. But I’m not trying to judge. He has a good sense of the visual, of what’s needed in a close-up. Sometimes he’d beat himself up so bad. He’d stick his fingers down his throat, things like that.’

Robert had previously opened up on what he put himself through in order to personify Ephrain, who slowly descended into madness after mundane task, after mundane task in the Lighthouse.

Carrying out chores such as cleaning, scrubbing floors and carrying coal, living on the remote island affects the apprentice as he begins murdering seagulls and screaming about wanting steak.

It’s a trip.

Earlier this month, the recently-announced Batman actor revealed more than we could ever imagine as he described ‘playing a mad person’.

‘It means you can sort of be mad the whole time. Well, not the whole time, but for like an hour before the scene,’ he explained to Esquire magazine.

Going further to give the people what they want, Robert said he was ‘basically unconscious the whole time’ while filming moments his character is drunk off kerosene, which seems like an easy day on the job.

‘It was crazy,’ Robert went on. ‘I spent so much time making myself throw up. Pissing my pants. It’s the most revolting thing. I don’t know, maybe it’s really annoying.’

Maybe.

It wasn’t all urinating on himself and throwing up, though, as he added he also spent time spinning around in circles before takes to really get into the mad man mentality, while also putting rocks in his shoes – which is enough to send anyone around the bend.

The Lighthouse is in UK cinemas 31 January, 2020.
